<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Cost Accountant

Location: Hicksville, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Scope of Responsibility: Responsible for ensuring accurate product costing and inventory accounting for a manufacturing plant in Hicksville, OH. This position will support department managers, supervisors, and Director of Finance with requests for financial information and provide timely information on plant metrics. Essential Duties: Collaborate with the Director of Finance and plant management to explain results, make improvements, manage projects, identify inefficiencies, understand operations, and lead the development of complex analysis.Serve as partner to production teams in identifying and developing various reports and analyzing variances to drive efficiencies and information needs across the company.Research and investigate discrepancies.Monitor and verify accurate inventory transactions.Reconcile inventory accounts to the general ledger and maintain accurate Raw Materials, WIP, and Finished Goods Inventories.Ensure that completed jobs are closed and costed correctly.Plan and manage weekly cycle counts.Maintain integrity of cost accounting records in company ERP and accounting system.Monitor expected gross margin through project completion to identify any variances to budget.Prepare monthly journal entries as needed.Additional duties as assigned.
Position Requirements:3 – 5 years of Cost AccountingExperience in a multi-site, manufacturing environment.Understanding of manufacturing job costing.Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Accounting required.Advanced Microsoft Excel required.An understanding of GAAP in relation to inventory.Strong understanding of business processes and basic corporate finance, management and accounting principlesExcellent communication, detailed analytical and interpersonal skills are required.Ability to work independently.
Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.Must be able to lift to 15 pounds at times  Sabre Wide Cultural Elements:Integrity- We are integrous. We build trust and respect every day and it is the foundational value we stand tall on. Commitment – We stay committed. We empower each other to take ownership of our goals and we execute together.Innovation- We remain innovative. It’s in our nature to deliver the highest quality and best in class solutions.Connection- We are connected. We connect our diverse cultures and will continue to connect the inclusive communities we serve. Sabre Industries is an Equal Opportunity Employer: M/F/Vets/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
